channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-11607] Export tables broken for data > 32 MB
item.description: Broken for both hadoop-1 as well as hadoop-2 line
item.summary: Export tables broken for data > 32 MB

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Stack trace:

java.io.IOException: Cannot get DistCp constructor: org.apache.hadoop.tools.DistCp.<init>()
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.shims.Hadoop23Shims.runDistCp(Hadoop23Shims.java:1160)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.common.FileUtils.copy(FileUtils.java:553)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.exec.CopyTask.execute(CopyTask.java:82)
cc: spena

Also, Hadoop20Shims.runDistCp seems to refer to "org.apache.hadoop.tools.distcp2" as a classname - since org.apache.hadoop.tools.distcp2.DistCp would be the appropriate class, I'm not sure it works for 1.0 either unless I'm reading this incorrectly.
https://reviews.apache.org/r/37635/

Overall: -1 no tests executed

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12751439/HIVE-11607.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12751439 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

Looks good to me, +1. (Agree with Swarnim's comment on RB as well, in that comments on the default options being set for DistCpOptions might be nice)

+cc mithun
Thanks, guys. For my curiosity,is it broken only for data greater than 32MB or irregardless the data size? Just wondering if 32MB is some sort of threshold.

xuefuz 32MB is default config at which point distcp triggers, otherwise data is copied via HDFS copy util. see: FileUtils::copy() So, in default case things work fine, but if distcp is triggered than we have problem.
Good to know. Thanks, ashutoshc.

sushanth , swarnim I am just imitating what was there in the code earlier, which was accomplishing this with cmd line args. I just changed it to programatic access. I don't have good idea why these options were chosen. spena Were it you who added this code? If so, may be you can shed if we need those options and if so, why.

Overall: -1 at least one tests failed

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12751619/HIVE-11607.3.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12751619 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

Hi ashutoshc

I added that code because there were some issues in CDH when compiling the code. CDH compiles against hadoop-2 even if it runs with MR1 or MR2. And the distcp for MR1 was failing to compile.

I see the problem is that the JAR for distcp is not downloaded by maven when using dynamic class loading.
I reviewed it, and it looks good. (+1)

Thanks for fixing this here.
Pushed to master. Thanks, Sergio & Sushanth for review!
Should this issue be backported to branch-1? It looks like a bug.

prasanth_j committed this to branch-1 on December 8, 2015, so Fix Version/s needs to include 1.3.0.

See commit 4cdd19a337ccbfd72f8a3b479cc0eb48f544d2e3.

We ran into this as well. Thanks a lot for the fix folks!
One thing I did notice though is https://github.com/apache/hive/blob/master/shims/0.23/pom.xml#L186 

 <scope>provided</scope>

.
Unfortunately, hadoop distcp is in the tools directory, which has been dropped from being loaded on the default classpath. So we had to play some games for the Hive CLI to pick up this jar
raviprak How is that issue fix? Removing {{provided}] would work?

Hi Sergio! For now we chose to :

export HIVE_CLASSPATH=$HADOOP_PREFIX/share/hadoop/tools/lib/*

This makes the assumption that the distcp jars are in that location. Also, since we are including everything in the tools directory now, there may be conflicts. I'll update the JIRA if we see problems rolling this out
This fix breaks DistCp copies in Hadoop 2.5.0+ (due to HADOOP-10459). See HIVE-13704.
